name: Food A-Z Quiz Series - B | Food & Drink | 10 Questions

questions.text: This vegetable is also known as the Chinese cabbage. What is this called?
questions.explanation:
Bok Choy.

	Bok choy is related to the turnip, but looks more like celery. The vegetable is of Chinese descent, and is often called Chinese cabbage. It is little wonder, then, that it is also related to cabbage.

questions.text: Mornay sauce is made by blending this sauce with cheese.  This sauce is a key ingredient to many lasagnas.  What is this sauce?
questions.explanation:
Bechamel.

	Bechamel sauce is known as white sauce.  To make Bechamel sauce, scalded milk is whisked into a roux, which is a butter and flour mixture that is the thickening agent to many sauces.

questions.text: This sauce is the most common sauce used for steak Oscar.  The sauce is poured all over crab, steak, and asparagus.  What could this sauce be?
questions.explanation:
Bernaise.

	Bernaise sauce is yellow in color.  It is thought of as a very simple sauce, although it is difficult to perfect.  The sauce is made of egg yolk and butter, and is flavored with shallots and tarragon.

questions.text: What vegetable do many people refer to as "little green trees?"
questions.explanation:
Broccoli.

	Broccoli resembles, and is related to, cauliflower.  Broccoli and cauliflower both look like little trees, and broccoli is green and cauliflower is white.  The flavor differs greatly despite the close resemblance, however.  A very popular way to serve broccoli is with cheese sauce.

questions.text: Which of these is a thin French bread?
questions.explanation:
Baguette.

	The baguette is a specific shape of French bread.  It is very thin, only about 5 or 6 centimers in diameter.  It is noted for its extra crispy crust and the slits across it that causes the gases to escape while cooking.  It is also usually very long.

questions.text: Which of these is a fish stew?
questions.explanation:
Bouillabaisse.

	Bouillabaisse is a fish stew that originated in Marseilles.  The word "bouillabaisse" is a term that combines two words, one meaning boil, the other meaning simmer.

questions.text: Which of these is a German sausage?
questions.explanation:
Bratwurst.

	"Brat" means fine chopped meat, and "wurst" means sausage.  Therefore, a bratwurst is a sausage made with fine chopped meat.  It is not, however, derived from the German term "braten," which means to pan fry.  This is a common misconception.

questions.text: This condiment is made of tomato paste, vinegar, and a large number of spices.  The sauce is used to dip kielbasa in, or to pair with steaks or ribs.  What is this sauce?
questions.explanation:
Barbecue sauce.

	Barbecue sauce is a very common ingredient to many foods cooked on a grill.  Barbecue sauce is very easy to make.  It involves tomato paste, vinegar, mustard, spices, and sugar or other sweeteners to keep it a bit tangy.  Barbecue sauce makes a myriad of foods, like barbecue ribs, pork, chicken, pizza, etc.

questions.text: Which of these will most likely stain your clothes?
questions.explanation:
Beet.

	Beets have a "dye" in them that cause things to turn deep red, so you need to be careful with them.  Beets are commonly eaten pickled.  Another way to eat beets is by making beet juice jelly.  This jelly does not taste like beet, though.  The beet simply gives a sweet base for the jelly.  The other three options will not stain your fingers or clothes much, if at all.  The blood orange, although blood stains clothes, will not stain you, because the juice itself isn't blood!

questions.text: This chicken recipe uses alcohol to flavor it.  What could this be?
questions.explanation:
Bourbon chicken.

	Cordon bleu is a chicken stuffed with ham and cheese.  Bourbon chicken is an American dish that is often found in Chinese restaurants.  It was first invented in Louisiana, which is why the food fits in the "cajun" category.
